slides.title: Welcome to Crawling & Indexing
slides.content:
# Crawling & Indexing üï∑Ô∏è

Control how search engines discover and store your content.

## What You'll Learn:
- **Crawling** - How bots discover pages
- **robots.txt** - Control crawler access
- **Sitemaps** - Guide crawlers to pages
- **Canonical Tags** - Prevent duplicates
- **Indexing** - Get pages into search results

> üí° If it's not indexed, it won't rank!

slides.title: How Crawling Works
slides.content:
# How Crawling Works ü§ñ

## The Process:
```
Crawler discovers URL
        ‚îÇ
        ‚ñº
Check robots.txt
        ‚îÇ
        ‚ñº
Fetch page content
        ‚îÇ
        ‚ñº
Extract links
        ‚îÇ
        ‚ñº
Add to crawl queue
```

## Crawl Budget:
- Number of pages crawled per visit
- Larger sites need optimization
- Fresh content crawled more often

## Factors:
| Factor | Impact |
|--------|--------|
| Site speed | More crawling |
| Fresh content | Priority crawling |
| Internal links | Helps discovery |
| Server errors | Less crawling |

slides.title: robots.txt Basics
slides.content:
# robots.txt ü§ñ

Control what crawlers can access.

## Location:
```
https://example.com/robots.txt
```

## Basic Syntax:
```
# Allow all
User-agent: *
Allow: /

# Block all
User-agent: *
Disallow: /

# Block specific paths
User-agent: *
Disallow: /admin/
Disallow: /private/
Disallow: /*.pdf$

# Sitemap reference
Sitemap: https://example.com/sitemap.xml
```

## Target Specific Bots:
```
User-agent: Googlebot
Allow: /

User-agent: Bingbot
Disallow: /temp/
```

slides.title: robots.txt Best Practices
slides.content:
# robots.txt Best Practices ‚úÖ

## Do Block:
- Admin areas
- User accounts
- Search results pages
- Cart/checkout
- Private content
- Duplicate content

## Don't Block:
- CSS/JS files (needed for rendering)
- Important images
- Public content you want indexed

## Common Patterns:
```
# Block URL parameters
Disallow: /*?*

# Block specific file types  
Disallow: /*.pdf$

# Allow specific path in blocked folder
Disallow: /private/
Allow: /private/public-page
```

## Testing:
- Google Search Console robots.txt Tester
- Validate before deploying

slides.title: XML Sitemaps
slides.content:
# XML Sitemaps üó∫Ô∏è

Tell search engines about your pages.

## Basic Structure:
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<urlset xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9">
    <url>
        <loc>https://example.com/</loc>
        <lastmod>2024-01-15</lastmod>
        <changefreq>weekly</changefreq>
        <priority>1.0</priority>
    </url>
    <url>
        <loc>https://example.com/about</loc>
        <lastmod>2024-01-10</lastmod>
        <priority>0.8</priority>
    </url>
</urlset>
```

## Tags:
| Tag | Required | Description |
|-----|----------|-------------|
| loc | Yes | Page URL |
| lastmod | No | Last modified date |
| changefreq | No | Update frequency |
| priority | No | Relative importance |

slides.title: Sitemap Index
slides.content:
# Sitemap Index üìö

For sites with many URLs.

## Limits:
- 50,000 URLs per sitemap
- 50MB uncompressed size
- Use sitemap index for more

## Sitemap Index:
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<sitemapindex xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9">
    <sitemap>
        <loc>https://example.com/sitemap-pages.xml</loc>
        <lastmod>2024-01-15</lastmod>
    </sitemap>
    <sitemap>
        <loc>https://example.com/sitemap-posts.xml</loc>
        <lastmod>2024-01-15</lastmod>
    </sitemap>
</sitemapindex>
```

## Best Practices:
- Gzip compress large sitemaps
- Split by content type
- Update lastmod dates
- Submit to Search Console

slides.title: Canonical Tags
slides.content:
# Canonical Tags üîó

Prevent duplicate content issues.

## The Problem:
```
/products
/products/
/products?color=blue
/products?ref=facebook
```
All show same content = duplicate!

## The Solution:
```html
<link rel="canonical" href="https://example.com/products">
```

## Use Cases:
- URL parameters
- www vs non-www
- HTTP vs HTTPS
- Trailing slashes
- Syndicated content

## Best Practices:
- ‚úÖ Absolute URLs
- ‚úÖ Self-referencing
- ‚úÖ One per page
- ‚ùå Canonical to redirects
- ‚ùå Canonical to 404s

slides.title: Meta Robots
slides.content:
# Meta Robots Tag ü§ñ

Page-level indexing control.

## Syntax:
```html
<meta name="robots" content="index, follow">
```

## Directives:
| Directive | Meaning |
|-----------|--------|
| index | Include in search |
| noindex | Exclude from search |
| follow | Follow links on page |
| nofollow | Don't follow links |
| noarchive | No cached version |
| nosnippet | No description shown |

## Examples:
```html
<!-- Private page -->
<meta name="robots" content="noindex, nofollow">

<!-- Index but no cache -->
<meta name="robots" content="index, noarchive">
```

## X-Robots-Tag Header:
```
X-Robots-Tag: noindex, nofollow
```
For PDFs and non-HTML files.

slides.title: Pagination
slides.content:
# Handling Pagination üìÑ

## Best Practices:

### 1. Unique Content Per Page:
```
/products?page=1 ‚Üí Products 1-20
/products?page=2 ‚Üí Products 21-40
```

### 2. View-All Page:
```html
<link rel="canonical" href="/products/all">
```

### 3. Self-Referencing Canonical:
```html
<!-- On page 2 -->
<link rel="canonical" href="/products?page=2">
```

### 4. Prev/Next (deprecated but useful):
```html
<link rel="prev" href="/products?page=1">
<link rel="next" href="/products?page=3">
```

## Tips:
- Don't noindex paginated pages
- Ensure crawlable links
- Keep page count reasonable

slides.title: Hreflang for Languages
slides.content:
# Hreflang Tags üåç

For multilingual/regional sites.

## Syntax:
```html
<link rel="alternate" hreflang="en" href="https://example.com/page">
<link rel="alternate" hreflang="es" href="https://example.com/es/page">
<link rel="alternate" hreflang="fr" href="https://example.com/fr/page">
<link rel="alternate" hreflang="x-default" href="https://example.com/page">
```

## Language-Region:
```html
<link rel="alternate" hreflang="en-US" href="/en-us/page">
<link rel="alternate" hreflang="en-GB" href="/en-gb/page">
```

## Rules:
- Include on ALL versions
- Use x-default for fallback
- Can be in sitemap too
- Must be reciprocal

slides.title: Indexing Issues
slides.content:
# Common Indexing Issues ‚ùå

## Page Not Indexed:
1. Check robots.txt
2. Check meta robots
3. Check canonical tag
4. Verify in Search Console

## Duplicate Content:
- Set canonical tags
- 301 redirect duplicates
- Use consistent URLs

## Crawl Errors:
- Fix 404 errors
- Reduce redirects chains
- Improve server response

## Search Console Tools:
- URL Inspection
- Coverage report
- Sitemap status
- robots.txt tester
